lines.text: [as he comes home]
Edra? Edra? Where are you? Edra... you heard it on the radio?
I... I left the groceries on the table.
You heard? About the plane?
There's... frozen orange juice. It should go in the... refrigerator.
For God's sake, what are you talking about, frozen orange juice? Chana... is in the plane. With terrorists!
I... I've been thinking. I should... never have let her wear that red ribbon.

[as he browses through the radio channels]
What red ribbon?
Around her neck.

[turns the radio off]
Nothing on the radio.
She wanted to grow up to go to Paris.
She could be killed! What are you talking about, her ribbon?
Suppose... suppose they let the children go. They'll never see that she's... just a little girl! They'll think she's a woman!
[at Entebbe Airport, as he sees a blue car and some men approaching the plane]

[excited]
They're Israelis! They're going to get us out of here!
I don't think they're Israelis.
No, they're Jews! You can tell! I'm telling you! It's alright!
[the female terrorists runs to the men and hugs them]
I don't think they're Jews.

[surprised]
Oh. Where do they come from?
Probably Kampala. It's about 30 kilometers from here.
Well, they're...
Arabs. Arabs... You can tell... Arabs.
What are you reading?
Agatha Christie.
You read that one in Tel Aviv!
Um-hum, I know. But fortunately, I have just gotten older and absent-minded enough to have forgotten who the murderer is!
[before the Israelis are separated from the other hostages]
Mother, you have a British passport. You stay with the others!
Etta Grossman-Wise. Even a German might suspect something.
[Mrs. Wise is staring at one of the terrorists]
Mother, you have to sit around for the take-off.
He has a box.
Who has?
a gun, a bomb...
Mother!
We should have travelled El Al.
They were all booked.
I don't like Athens.
I know. Very bad security in Athens.
You could come in to Athens from anywhere, and nobody will check between the transit lounge and another plane.
[repeated line]
The government of Israel does not negotiate with terrorists!
[after hearing the female terrorist yelling orders in German]
The woman is a Nazi.
Mother, now don't get excited!
I'm not excited. I took a Valium. The woman is still a Nazi.
Where do you think, Mr. Olav? You've had an extensive military background. Where do you think we're going?
What?
My son says Khartoum. On the other hand, this gentleman...
Haroun.
...says Somalia. And as for me... I think India!
India?
Why not? I've never been to India! They have erotic temples there, I'm told. I've never seen an erotic temple.
That's ridiculous! India? Who ever heard of being hijacked to India?
Well, everybody has an opinion. Now, it's your turn.
I don't know!
Well, think it over. When you decide it, let us know, hum?
India, hum? India... Humph! Pfah! India!
[Olav and Haroun leave]
Are you serious? India?
Certainly!
[pause]
Or China.
